result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth C Mingo

records.addlTxt: Letter to Clerk of Courts re: Billable Hours

[ma] Cases 21CF364, 21CF604, 22CF378 called at 2:00pm 
Defendant Kenneth C Mingo in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Kenneth C Mingo.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, and #6 of Case 21CF364 and Count #1 of Case 21CF604; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Remaining Counts of Cases 21CF364, 21CF604, 22CF378

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Counts #1, #2, #3, and #6 of Case 21CF364 and Count #1 of Case 21CF604, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no violent contact with Victim 1
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $155 subpoena fees(21CF364) and $25 drug testing fee(21CF604) through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$2920 plus attorney fees] The Court grants installment payments of $25 per month beginning 1/1/23 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment will result in  47 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive for Case 21CF364 and 11 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive for Case 21CF604

Days credit for time already served:  4 days as to Case 21CF364
recess: 2:30pm
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ae] case called 9:19 AM Defendant Kenneth C Mingo in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court. ADA Michaels n in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and provides updated address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1

recess 9:23 am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference 11/1/22 at 2:30 pm with Defendants other case

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth C Mingo
Current: 604 N 2nd St, Watertown, WI 53094   (Effective: 08-19-2022)
Prior: 710 Franklin St Apt 4, Watertown, WI 53094
If Defense opposes joinder, it shall file a response in writing by eob 10/25
State's Memorandum and Brief in Support of the Motion for Joinder
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] case called 11:30 AM Defendant Kenneth C Mingo not in court. DA Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Huebner appeared [appointed to defendants other cases]
The Court adjourns for proper service
recess: 11:32 am
NEXT: Initial Appearance 10/17/22 at 8:30 am
[[Post-Hearing, the Court appoints Atty Huebner to this case as he is Court Appointed in the Defendants other pending cases. Re-payment terms to be added to current plan with other cases]]
